get.description: This will show all cluster controllers in a subscription.

put.description: Create a new Network Cloud cluster or update the properties of the cluster if it exists. The API returns 201 Created when a new cluster is created along with its properties. For the existing cluster update, the API returns 200 OK and the updated properties.
put.summary: Creates or updates a specific network cloud cluster.

delete.description: Delete a provided Network Cloud cluster. The API returns 200 OK when the deletion is successful.
delete.summary: Deletes a specific Network Cloud cluster.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Patch the properties of a specific network cloud cluster, or update the tags assigned to the cluster. Properties and tag updates can be done independently. The API returns 200 OK when the API is successful.
patch.summary: Patches a specific network cloud cluster.

tags.description: Azure resource tags that will replace the existing ones. Tags update can be performed separately from the properties.

AzureCommonProperties.description:
AzureCommonProperties are parameters that can be included on requests but are processed by RPaaS and not by this
resource provider. They are listed as optional resources because RPaaS will enforce which parameters are required.

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

BareMetalMachineProperties.title: BareMetalMachineProperties represents the properties of a baremetal machine.

bmcConnectionString.description:
BmcConnectionString is the connection string for the bare-metal controller on this bare-metal machine.
+kubebuilder:validation:Required

bootMacAddress.description:
BootMacAddress is the MAC address of a NIC connected to the PXE network.
+kubebuilder:validation:Required

clusterID.description: ClusterID is the fully-qualified identifier of the undercloud cluster this BareMetalMachine is associated with.

machineDetails.description:
Details provided by the customer during the creation of rack manifests
that allows for custom data to be associated with this machine
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional

machineLocation.description:
A user-friendly description of the BareMetalMachine's location
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional

oamMacAddress.description:
OamMacAddress is the MAC address of a NIC connected to the OAM network.
+kubebuilder:validation:Required

rackID.description: Associated Microsoft.NetworkCloud/racks/rackName where this BareMetalMachine resides

rackSlot.description:
RackSlot is the slot in which this physical machine is located, ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot
is 1.
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional
+kubebuilder:validation:Minimum=1

readyState.description:
Is the BareMetalMachine ready to receive workloads
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional
+kubebuilder:default=true

tpmEndorsementKey.description:
TPMEndorsementKey is the thumbprint or SHA of the TPM Endorsement Key that allows the resource provider to ensure
authenticity of the machine.
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional

bmcConnectionString.description: BmcConnectionString is the connection string for the bare-metal controller on this bare-metal machine.

bmcMacAddress.description: BmcMacAddress is the MAC address of the bare-metal controller on this machine.

bootMacAddress.description: BootMacAddress is the MAC address of a NIC connected to the PXE network.

machineDetails.description: MachineDetails is an optional value containing additional details such as SerialNumber, AssetTag, etc.

machineName.description:
MachineName is the user provided name for the BareMetalMachine created from this user data.
If not provided, a name will be generated programmatically.

rackSlot.description:
RackSlot is the slot in which this physical machine is located,
ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot is 1.

tpmEndorsementKey.description:
TPMEndorsementKey is the thumbprint or SHA of the TPM Endorsement Key that allows the resource provider to ensure
authenticity of the machine.

BmcCredentials.description: Credentials for the BMC device on this baremetal machine

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

target.description: The target of the particular error. For example, the name of the property in error.

CloudErrorBody.title: CloudErrorBody represents the body of a cloud error.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

details.description: A list of additional details about the error.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

target.description: The target of the particular error. For example, the name of the property in error.

Cluster.description: A cluster is the top level object for the on-premise environment.
Cluster.title: Cluster represents an on-Premise Network Cloud cluster

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

ClusterControllerList.description: ClusterControllerList represents a list of cluster controller objects.
ClusterControllerList.title: List of cluster controller objects.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterControllerManifest.description: ClusterControllerManifest includes request body parameters for create cluster controller

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: AnalyticsWorkspace is where any logs relevant to customer will be relayed for example "/microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces/{logAnalyticsWorkspaceName}

fabricControllerId.description: URI reference to the fabric controller that is 1:1 with the cluster controller.

ClusterControllerProperties.description: ClusterControllerProperties represents the properties of a cluster controller

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: AnalyticsWorkspace is where any logs relevant to customer will be relayed for example "/microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces/{logAnalyticsWorkspaceName}

clusterVersions.description: ClusterVersions represents all the cluster versions the controller supports. which would be used as input in the cluster clusterVersion property.

controllerExtendedLocation.description: ControllerExtendedLocation used when creating cluster and rack manifest.

fabricControllerId.description: URI reference to the fabric controller that is 1:1 with the cluster controller

ClusterControllers.description: A ClusterController creates and  manages customer controller instances on demand.
ClusterControllers.title: ClusterController represents a control-plane to manage one or more on-premises Clusters.

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

ClusterList.title: ClusterList represents a list of Clusters.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterProperties.description:
https://armwiki.azurewebsites.net/rpaas/arc-rp/conversion/SchemaTranslation.html#default-kubernetes-bridge-mapping

for now, we'll align on the same concept for our RPaaS
objects as well

ClusterProperties represents the properties of a cluster.
ClusterProperties.title:
Note, k8s bridge resource types will default to
a singular status field under properties

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: The customer must specify a Log Analytics Workspace upon creation. This workspace will be where any logs that are relevant to

availableUpgradeVersions.description: AvailableUpgradeVersions represents all the cluster runtime version upgrades available for this cluster.

clusterExtendedLocation.description:
The extended location (custom location) represents the cluster's control plane location.
This extended location is used to route the requests of child objects of the cluster that are handled by the platform operator.

clusterLocation.description: ClusterLocation is customer-provided location information provided to identify where the cluster resides.

clusterManagerId.description:
ClusterManagerId is an reference to the ID of the cluster manager that manages this cluster.
This is set by the Cluster Manager when the cluster is created.

clusterType.description:
ClusterType is the type of rack configuration for this cluster.
single-rack SingleRack
multi-rack MultiRack

clusterVersion.description: ClusterVersion depicts the current version of the cluster runtime.

provisioningState.description:
ProvisioningState is the provisioning state of the cluster.
Validating Validating
Provisioning Provisioning
Succeeded Succeeded
Failed Failed
provisioningState.x-go-enum-desc:
Validating Validating
Provisioning Provisioning
Succeeded Succeeded
Failed Failed

clusterTrusted.description: ClusterTrusted indicates whether or not to trust that the cluster is uncompromised.

deploymentState.description: DeploymentState indicates the status of the cluster's deployment (e.g. Pending, Deployed)

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

ClustersBootstrapImagesList.title: BootstrapImageList represents a list of bootstrap Images for a cluster.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClustersBootstrapImagesProperties.title: ClusterBootstrapImagesProperties represents the properties of a cluster bootstrap Image.

CreatedByType.description: CreatedByType defines user type, which executed the request

HardwareConfiguration.description: including information acquired from the model/sku information and from the ironic inspector.
HardwareConfiguration.title: Hardwareconfiguration is the hardware configuration of this machine as exposed to the customer,

model.description:
Note: This struct is expected to change over time as details are agreed upon
ModelNumber represents the SKU of this machine

serialNumber.description:
SerialNumber is an optional serial number or other asset tag identifier that a user may use to associate with
this machine.

NetworkAddresses.description: Network addresses that are assigned to this machine from the CIDRs assigned to the rack that contains this machine

Rack.description:
NOTE: There may be some differences between a Rack and RackManifest as we add logic to process a RackManifest;
however, a Rack is just an alias of the RackManifest type in this initial implementation.
Rack.title: Rack is the validated/processed representation of a rack located in an on-premises cluster.

RackManifest.title: RackManifest is the unprocessed, user-submitted intention for a rack located in an on-premises cluster.

extendedLocation.description: the extended location of the cluster controller that manages this rack manifest

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

RackManifestList.title: RackManifestList represents a list of RackManifests.

RackManifestProperties.title: RackManifestProperties represesnts the properties of a rack manifest.

baremetalMachineUserData.description: BareMetalMachineUserData is a list of machine objects in this rack.

clusterId.description: ClusterId is the name of the cluster to which this rack will be associated.

clusterSlot.description: ClusterSlot identifies this rack's placement within a cluster.

modelId.description: ModelId is the Model ID of this rack.

rackId.description: A reference to the rack that was realized by the deployment of this rackManifest

rackLocation.description: RackLocation is a user description of the location of this rack, e.g. "DTN Datacenter, Floor 3, Aisle 9, Rack 2".

rackSerialNumber.description: RackSerialNumber is a globally unique identifier for an AFO-NC rack.

SystemData.title: SystemData metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

VirtualMachine.description: VirtualMachine represents an on-Premises Network Cloud virtual machine

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

VirtualMachineList.title: VirtualMachineList represents a list of VirtualMachines.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

VirtualMachineNetworkAttachment.description: VirtualMachineNetworkAttachement represents a single network attachment

ipAllocationMethod.description: IPAllocationMethod defines mechanism for ip allocation.

ipv4Address.description:
IPv4Address represents ipv4 address of a VM.
This field is only used if the associated WorkloadNetwork has a IPAllocationType of IPv4 or Dual-Stack.
If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv4 address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

ipv6Address.description:
IPv6Address represents ipv6 address of a VM.
This field is only used if the associated WorkloadNetwork has a IPAllocationType of IPv6 or Dual-Stack.
If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv6 address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

VirtualMachinePlacementHint.description: VirtualMachinePlacementHint represents a single scheduling hint of virtual machine

VirtualMachineProperties.title: VirtualMachineProperties represents the properties of a virtual machine.

bareMetalMachineURI.description: URI to the bare metal machine VM has landed to.

cluster.description: Name of undercloud cluster VM is created with.

diskSizeGB.description: Virtual machine root disk size in GiB.

imageReference.description: URL to virtual machine OCI image.

memorySizeGB.description: Virtual machine memory size in GiB.

networkConfigurationVersion.description: Version of virtual machine network configuration.

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

tags.description: Tags are Azure resource tags that will be added to the referenced resource.

WorkloadNetworkList.title: WorkloadNetworkList represents a list of WorkloadNetwork.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

WorkloadNetworkProperties.title: WorkloadNetworkProperties represents the properties of a Workload Network.

adminStatus.description: AdminStatus is the admin status of the Workload Network.

cluster.description: Cluster is the name of the undercloud cluster this Workload Network is associated with.

ipAllocationType.description: IP Allocation Type defaults to Dual-Stack.

ipv4AddressPrefixIndex.description: Index of the IPv4AddressPrefix array from the Routing Domain to be used for this Workload Network.

ipv6AddressRangeIndex.description: Index of the IPv6RangePrefix array from the Routing Domain to be used for this Workload Network.

maxTxRate.description: Maximum tx rate, in Mbps, for the VF.

minTxRate.description: Minimum tx rate, in Mbps, for the VF.

routingDomains.description: RoutingDomain associated to the Workload Network.
